content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
A CSS rule consists of a selector and a declaration block. CSS Syntax The selector points to the HTML element you want to style. The declaration block contains one or more declarations separated by semicolons. Each declaration includes a CSS property name and a value, separated by a colon. Multiple CSS declarations are separated with semicolons, and declaration blocks are surrounded by curly braces. Example In this example all

elements will be center-aligned, with a red text color: p { color: red; text-align: center; } Example Explained p is a selector in CSS (it points to the HTML element you want to style:

). color is a property, and red is the property value text-align is a property, and center is the property value You will learn much more about CSS selectors and CSS properties in the Video: CSS Syntax ★ +1
